modules.description: Provides functions to manage manual byte input and output for custom encoding and decoding processes. Operates with decoders and encoders, using byte arrays to transfer data between them. Used to feed input to a decoder in controlled chunks and track remaining space in an output buffer during encoding.

Processes UTF-encoded strings by iterating over characters and their positions, supporting UTF-8, UTF-16BE, and UTF-16LE encodings. Identifies the encoding of a string and detects byte order marks. Enables character-by-character processing with position tracking for text analysis or transformation tasks.

Adds UTF-8, UTF-16BE, and UTF-16LE encoded characters to a buffer. Operates on `Buffer.t` and `Uchar.t` to handle Unicode character encoding. Used to construct byte sequences for network protocols or file formats requiring specific Unicode encodings.

Provides functions to decode and encode UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-16LE, and UTF-16BE, processing data character by character without blocking on I/O. Supports character position tracking, newline normalization, and folding over characters in UTF-encoded OCaml strings. Enables direct encoding of characters into OCaml Buffer.t values.

Encodes and decodes UTF-8, UTF-16BE, and UTF-16LE using byte arrays and buffers, supporting character-by-character processing and position tracking. Provides functions to fold over UTF-encoded strings, detect encodings, and manage byte input/output for custom workflows. Enables efficient handling of Unicode data in text analysis, network protocols, and file formats. Operations include encoding `Uchar.t` values into buffers and decoding byte sequences into characters with newline normalization.
